abstract.text: 1 2 3 -1 -3 non-inferiority limit Favors control Favors intervention Supplementary Figure 1: Comparison of arms for participant retention in antiretroviral treatment care (primary outcome) after 12 months.

Participant losses included those through mortality and loss to follow-up. Effect measures are adjusted risk differences from population-averaged generalized estimating equations specified for clustering by facility. Estimates adjusted for age category, district and randomization stratum.

body_text.text: Participant losses included those through mortality, loss to follow-up, transfer to other facilities, and transition off the arm due to requiring increased frequency of antiretroviral treatment dispensing. Effect measures are adjusted risk differences from populationaveraged generalized estimating equations specified for clustering by facility. Estimates adjusted for age category, district and randomization stratum.
body_text.section: Supplementary Figure 2: Comparison of arms for participant retention in the study arm (retention by randomized strategy) after 12 months.

BIBREF2.title: Estimates from multinomial logit regression models specifying for clustering by facility and using unsuppressed viral load as the base category

BIBREF3.title: Estimates using log-binomial regresson with generalized estimating equations specifying for clustering by facility and adjusted for randomization stratum, including only participants with available viral load results VL-Viral load; VS-viral suppression
